channel.title: home on Handbook
channel.description: Recent content in home on Handbook

item.title: Common Commands
item.description: cp # Copy files/folders between a container and the local filesystem. See also Docker Documentation. docker cp ./some_file CONTAINER:/work docker cp CONTAINER:/var/logs/ /tmp/app_logs

item.title: File
item.description: Extension # System.IO.Path.GetExtension # [System.IO.Path]::GetExtension(Draftv2.zip) Returns the extension (including the period “.”) of the specified path string. See also M$ Learn. FileSystemInfo.Extension # > (Get-ChildItem Draftv2.zip).Extension .zip > (Get-Item Draftv2.zip).Extension .zip Gets the extension part of the file name, including the leading dot . even if it is the entire file name, or an empty string if no extension is present. See also M$ Learn. Expand-Archive # Expand-Archive -Path Draftv2.

item.title: Common Expressions
item.description: CASE # CASE WHEN condition1 THEN result1 WHEN condition2 THEN result2 WHEN conditionN THEN resultN ELSE result END; The CASE expression goes through conditions and returns a value when the first condition is met (like an if-then-else statement). So, once a condition is true, it will stop reading and return the result. If no conditions are true, it returns the value in the ELSE clause.If there is no ELSE part and no conditions are true, it returns NULL.

item.title: Common Commands
item.description: Database # DBSIZE # DBSIZE Return the number of keys in the currently-selected database. see also redis.io. FLUSHALL # FLUSHALL [ASYNC | SYNC] Remove all keys from all database. see also redis.io. FLUSHDB # FLUSHDB [ASYNC | SYNC] Remove all keys from the current database. see also redis.io. SELECT # SELECT index Change the selected database for the current connection. see also redis.io. Key # KEYS # KEYS pattern Returns all keys matchingÂ pattern.

item.title: Common Functions
item.description: COALESCE # SELECT COALESCE(NULL, NULL, NULL, 'W3Schools.com', NULL, 'Example.com'); Return the first non-null value in a list. See also w3schools. IFNULL # SELECT IFNULL(NULL, "W3Schools.com"); Return the specified value IF the expression is NULL, otherwise return the expression. See also w3schools. IF # SELECT IF(500<1000, "YES", "NO"); The IF() function returns a value if a condition is TRUE, or another value if a condition is FALSE. See also w3schools.

item.title: Transations
item.description: Usage # > MULTI OK > INCR foo QUEUED > INCR bar QUEUED > EXEC 1) (integer) 1 2) (integer) 1 DISCARD # > SET foo 1 OK > MULTI OK > INCR foo QUEUED > DISCARD OK > GET foo "1" Optimistic locking using check-and-set # WATCH mykey val = GET mykey val = val + 1 MULTI SET mykey $val EXEC It is also possible to use the UNWATCH command manually in order to flush all the watched keys.

item.title: Views
item.description: Altering view # The CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW command updates a view. See also w3schools. CREATE OR REPLACE VIEW [Brazil Customers] AS SELECT CustomerName, ContactName, City FROM Customers WHERE Country = "Brazil"; WITH CHECK OPTION # The WITH CHECK OPTION clause can be given for an updatable view to prevent inserts to rows for which the WHERE clause in the select_statement is not true. It also prevents updates to rows for which the WHERE clause is true but the update would cause it to be not true (in other words, it prevents visible rows from being updated to nonvisible rows).

item.title: Stored Procedures
item.description: Defining Stored Programs in MySQL # If you use the mysql client program to define a stored program containing semicolon characters, a problem arises. By default, mysql itself recognizes the semicolon as a statement delimiter, so you must redefine the delimiter temporarily to cause mysql to pass the entire stored program definition to the server. To redefine the mysql delimiter, use the delimiter command. See also MySQL Reference manual.
